For f∈C0∞(R2)f \in C_0^\infty\p{\R^2}f∈C0∞​(R2) define u(x,t)u\p{x, t}u(x,t) by

u(x,t)=∫R2eix⋅ξsin⁡(t∣ξ∣)∣ξ∣f(ξ) dξ,x∈R2, t>0.u\p{x, t} = \int_{\R^2} e^{ix \cdot \xi} \frac{\sin\p{t\abs{\xi}}}{\abs{\xi}} f\p{\xi} \,\diff{\xi}, \quad x \in \R^2,\ t > 0.u(x,t)=∫R2​eix⋅ξ∣ξ∣sin(t∣ξ∣)​f(ξ)dξ,x∈R2, t>0.

Show that lim⁡t→∞∥u( ⋅ ,t)∥L2=∞\lim_{t\to\infty} \norm{u\p{\:\cdot\:, t}}_{L^2} = \inftylimt→∞​∥u(⋅,t)∥L2​=∞ for a set of fff that is dense in L2(R2)L^2\p{\R^2}L2(R2).
Solution.

Observe that uuu is defined as the inverse Fourier transform of

ξ↦sin⁡(t∣ξ∣)∣ξ∣f(ξ).\xi \mapsto \frac{\sin\p{t\abs{\xi}}}{\abs{\xi}} f\p{\xi}.ξ↦∣ξ∣sin(t∣ξ∣)​f(ξ).

Hence, by Plancherel,

∥u( ⋅ ,t)∥L22=∥ξ↦sin⁡(t∣ξ∣)∣ξ∣f(ξ)∥L22=∫R2(sin⁡(t∣ξ∣)∣ξ∣)2∣f(x)∣2 dξ≥∫{0≤t∣ξ∣≤π2}(2t∣ξ∣π∣ξ∣)2∣f(ξ)∣2 dξ=4t2π2∫{∣ξ∣≤π2t}∣f(ξ)∣2 dξ.\begin{aligned} \norm{u\p{\:\cdot\:, t}}_{L^2}^2 &= \norm{\xi \mapsto \frac{\sin\p{t\abs{\xi}}}{\abs{\xi}} f\p{\xi}}_{L^2}^2 \\ &= \int_{\R^2} \p{\frac{\sin\p{t\abs{\xi}}}{\abs{\xi}}}^2 \abs{f\p{x}}^2 \,\diff\xi \\ &\geq \int_{\set{0 \leq t\abs{\xi} \leq \frac{\pi}{2}}} \p{\frac{2t\abs{\xi}}{\pi\abs{\xi}}}^2 \abs{f\p{\xi}}^2 \,\diff\xi \\ &= \frac{4t^2}{\pi^2} \int_{\set{\abs{\xi} \leq \frac{\pi}{2t}}} \abs{f\p{\xi}}^2 \,\diff\xi. \end{aligned}∥u(⋅,t)∥L22​​=∥∥​ξ↦∣ξ∣sin(t∣ξ∣)​f(ξ)∥∥​L22​=∫R2​(∣ξ∣sin(t∣ξ∣)​)2∣f(x)∣2dξ≥∫{0≤t∣ξ∣≤2π​}​(π∣ξ∣2t∣ξ∣​)2∣f(ξ)∣2dξ=π24t2​∫{∣ξ∣≤2tπ​}​∣f(ξ)∣2dξ.​

Thus, if lim⁡ξ→0∣f(ξ)∣=∞\lim_{\xi\to0} \abs{f\p{\xi}} = \inftylimξ→0​∣f(ξ)∣=∞, then this tends to ∞\infty∞. It remains to show that {f∈L2(R2)∣lim⁡ξ→0∣(ξ)∣=∞}\set{f \in L^2\p{\R^2} \mid \lim_{\xi\to0} \abs{\p{\xi}} = \infty}{f∈L2(R2)∣limξ→0​∣(ξ)∣=∞} is dense in L2(R2)L^2\p{\R^2}L2(R2).

Let φ(ξ)=∣ξ∣−1/2χB(0,1)\phi\p{\xi} = \abs{\xi}^{-1/2}\chi_{B\p{0,1}}φ(ξ)=∣ξ∣−1/2χB(0,1)​ so that

∥φ∥L22=∫B(0,1)1∣ξ∣ dξ=∫01∫02πdθ dr=2π.\norm{\phi}_{L^2}^2 = \int_{B\p{0,1}} \frac{1}{\abs{\xi}} \,\diff\xi = \int_0^1 \int_0^{2\pi} \diff\theta \,\diff{r} = 2\pi.∥φ∥L22​=∫B(0,1)​∣ξ∣1​dξ=∫01​∫02π​dθdr=2π.

Thus, given f∈Cc(R2)f \in C_c\p{\R^2}f∈Cc​(R2) and ε>0\epsilon > 0ε>0,

lim⁡ξ→0 (f(ξ)+εφ(ξ))=∞and∥f−(f−εφ)∥L2=ε∥φ∥L2,\lim_{\xi\to0}\,\p{f\p{\xi} + \epsilon\phi\p{\xi}} = \infty \quad\text{and}\quad \norm{f - \p{f - \epsilon\phi}}_{L^2} = \epsilon\norm{\phi}_{L^2},ξ→0lim​(f(ξ)+εφ(ξ))=∞and∥f−(f−εφ)∥L2​=ε∥φ∥L2​,
